w:r.w:t: Department of Computer Science and Engineering / Chitkara University
Scope and Objectives of the Course
In this course, students will gain a broad understanding of the discipline of software engineering and its application to the development and management of software systems.
To acquire knowledge of basic software engineering methods and practices, and their appropriate application.
To understand the role of project management including planning, scheduling, risk management, etc.
To impart knowledge of software requirements, software testing approaches (such as unit testing and integration testing) and quality control and ensuring good quality software using latest tools.
Software Engineering, A practitioner’s Approach’ by Roger S. Pressman, 6th Edition, McGraw- Hill
Software Engineering by Pankaj Jalota, third edition
a Precise approach by Pankaj Jalote,2010,Wiley Publications.
Software Engineering by K.K Aggarwal and Yogesh Singh,New age Publications
Software Engineering by Ian Sommerville, sixth Edition, Adison- Wesley Pub. Co.
Link of Journals, Magazines, websites, MOOC Course and Research Papers
The Evolving Role of Software, Changing nature of software,
Evolutionary Process Models – Incremental Models, Spiral Model
what is agility, what is an agile process, agile process models: extreme programming(XP), ASD, Scrum
Requirements Engineering Tasks: Initiating Requirement, engineering Process, Eliciting Requirements
Requirement Analysis, Data modeling Concepts, Flow Oriented Modeling,
Design Concepts and model, Data design,Architectural design. Designing class based Components .User Interface Analysis and design, Interface analysis and Interface design steps.
A strategic approach for Software Testing,
Basis Path Testing, Control Structure Testing: condition and loop testing
Equivalence Partitioning and Boundary Value Analysis
The management spectrum, Metrics for process & project
Objective , Software Scope and Resources, Software Project Estimation and Decomposition Techniques(LOC,FP),
Software Risks & Risk Strategies, Risk Identification, Risk Projection, Risk Mitigation, Monitoring and Management (RMMM) plan
eory papers. The average of best two will be considered.

** The End Term Comprehensive examination will be held at the end of semester. The mandatory requirement of 75% attendance in all theory classes is to be met for being eligible to appear in this component.
